image.altText: A photo of Royal Hobart Hospital's K Block ward framed against a dark and cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's health department says it has been unable to corroborate a claim from the state's nursing and midwifery union that a baby died as a result of understaffing in the Royal Hobart Hospital's maternity ward â€” but has asked for anyone to come forward if they know about it.

title.children: Health Department says it can find no basis to claim Royal Hobart maternity ward short-staffing led to baby's death

image.altText: cash lays on a kitchen table beside a cup of tea and a list of bills owing

props.synopsis: The annual rate of inflation declined in July, as commonwealth and state rebates drove energy prices lower, the Bureau of Statistics said.

title.children: Inflation falls to 3.5pc in July as energy rebates help to push electricity prices lower

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding several pages of a household power bill in their hands

props.synopsis: Australia's peak energy user group and one of its biggest retailers sound the alarm on complex power prices, saying they're not working and may be harming.

title.children: Energy boss calls for rethink of power pricing after complex time-of-use tariffs found to do little but 'punish' consumers

image.altText: A tree that has fallen over a road.

props.synopsis: For Tasmanians fed up with the current wild weather over the state, it could take until end of next week for the rain and wind to blow away, the BOM says.

title.children: Storms and wet weather over Tasmania may take until next week to shift, BOM says

image.altText: Firefighter Edmonsen Park fire

props.synopsis: Authorities have downgraded a fire emergency in Sydney's south-west that had earlier threatened homes and has left several people injured.

title.children: Several people injured and homes threatened by grass fire in Sydney's south-west

image.altText: Max Chandler Mather CFMEU rally

props.synopsis: Greens leader Adam Bandt has defended his colleague's decision to attend a CFMEU protest where the prime minister was likened to Adolf Hitler, saying the event was "legitimate" despite the "offensive" comparison.

title.children: Greens leader defends MP's CFMEU rally attendance but says Nazi sign 'offensive'

image.altText: A soldier holding a big gun runs across a sandy road in front of an armoured vehicle.

props.synopsis: At least 10 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli raids and strikes on several towns in the north of the occupied West Bank, according to a Red Crescent spokesperson.Â

title.children: Ten Palestinians killed in Israeli raids and strikes on West Bank, humanitarian workers say

image.altText: Two woman standing in front of a conservatory wall with flowers.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Premier has signed a new deal with two ex-Jacqui Lambie Network MPs, as their former colleague describes them as "more Liberal than JLN".

title.children: Tasmanian Premier signs new deal with ex-Lambie MPs, as Jenner warns of 'line you can't cross'

image.altText: Bentinck Island fish traps from the air

props.synopsis: Traditional owners say World Heritage listing would help preserve Australia's largest archaeological site, an elaborate network of stone walls designed to trap fish at low tide in the Gulf of Carpentaria.

title.children: Calls to protect northern Australia's ancient stone wall fish traps from tourists, climate change

image.altText: University of Adelaide Vice-Chancellor Professor Peter Rathjen

props.synopsis: A University of Tasmania employee is alleging the former vice-chancellor groped her on three separate occasions without her consent.

title.children: Former UTAS vice-chancellor Peter Rathjen sued over alleged groping

image.altText: A woman smiling

props.synopsis: Polls put Kamala Harris slightly ahead of Donald Trump in the US election race. But there are two potential stumbling blocks that could up-end the contest once again.

title.children: Kamala Harris is ahead of Donald Trump, but two big wildcards could up-end the race

image.altText: Adam Bandt press club

props.synopsis: Content-wise, the Greens leader unabashedly promoted his movement's progressive ambitions to tax big corporations. But in style, his performance was pure Donald.Â

title.children: Adam Bandt's press club address was pure Trump, at least as far as style is concerned

image.altText: big build photo generic

props.synopsis: Federal Infrastructure Minister Catherine King has been rolled in her efforts to decrease the Commonwealth's share of major transport funding, with Tasmania and WA joining a state and territory pile-on.

title.children: State and territory pressure mounts on Catherine King as transport funding deal risks derailment

image.altText: A man in a hospital bed with tubes going into his nose and mouth.

props.synopsis: Hepatitis C attacked Dennis Maby's liver over two decades and nearly claimed his life. Now clear of the disease he's urging other people to get tested.

title.children: There's now a cure for Hepatitis C. Finding the people who need it is the challenge

image.altText: CCTV shows a man in a cap and button up running away.

props.synopsis: The baby boy was with his family in a park at Stones Corner when an unknown man allegedly approached them and poured boiling coffee over the infant.Â

title.children: Baby burned after stranger allegedly threw hot coffee in 'deliberate' attack at a Brisbane park

image.altText: About a dozen student are seen talking in a courtyard, in front of a tall sandstone clock tower at the University of Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The federal government's plan to cap international student numbers has split the tertiary education sector, drawing uproar from prestigious urban universities but cautious optimism from their regional and suburban competitors.

title.children: The government's international student cap proposal angers sandstone universities, but smaller players stand to gain

image.altText: Side photo of Queensland police car.

props.synopsis: The Gold Coast state school principal is charged with possessing child exploitation material and grooming children in the Philippines.

title.children: Queensland state school principal charged with child exploitation and grooming offences

image.altText: Mano Yogalingham smiles, dressed in a white shirt as he sits indoors.

props.synopsis: Friends of 23-year-old Mano Yogalingam told the ABC the young father arrived in Australia from Sri Lanka in 2013 and had been on a bridging visa for roughly 11 years.Â

title.children: Grief and shock in Melbourne after Tamil asylum seeker dies by self-immolation

image.altText: Cows graze in long grass on a roadside.

props.synopsis: The retailer updated its sustainability target, shifting from an existing net-zero deforestation goal, to become "deforestation-free" by the December 2025.

title.children: Woolworths supermaket says it will sell deforestation-free beef from end of 2025

image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds.

props.synopsis: Linda Reynolds's lawyer casts doubt on medical reports that claim Brittany Higgins is unfit to give evidence in the high-stakes defamation trial underway in Perth.

title.children: Medical reports failed to excuse Brittany Higgins from giving evidence, defamation trial told

image.altText: A man named Clifford Sunfly stands in front of a Toyota four-wheel drive.

props.synopsis: Ravaged by drug abuse, rampant unemployment and deep social dysfunction, Balgo is one of Australia's most remote communities. But there are opportunities on the horizon, as a community with ancient traditions looks to a modern future.

title.children: In Balgo, getting people into work is the battle. But locals are working hard to drive change

image.altText: Man with grey hair and glasses, standing in front of a wall full of old photographs

props.synopsis: Former champion swimming coach Richard "Dick" Caine raped and sexually assaulted young athletes at the pool and in his home and car, a judge finds.

title.children: Dying swim coach found to have raped and sexually assaulted six girls

image.altText: A clear IV drip with cords attached against a white wall.

props.synopsis: Federal Health Minister Mark Butler said the additional bags would ensure there was "more than enough to meet Australian demand over that period".

title.children: Federal government secures 22 million IV fluid bags amid global shortage

image.altText: Dr Cat holding a long balloon and pointing into the distance during a performance, with a planet projected in the background.

props.synopsis: If you were asked to picture a scientist you might picture someone head down, white coat and goggles on,but Dr Catriona Nguyen-Robertson's science career took her in a different direction â€” away from full-time work in a lab.

title.children: This scientist has 'never had a full-time job' â€” and here's why she doesn't need to

image.altText: Closeup of two people holding hands wearing jeans and walking

props.synopsis: Labor has moved to dump proposed questions that would create the first estimate of Australia's LGBTQIA+ population, with advocates saying it renders the community "invisible".

title.children: The 2026 census won't count LGBTQIA+ people, but why?

image.altText: Australian female para-swimmer Rachael Watson takes a breath during a race.

props.synopsis: Classifications are an essential part of the Paralympics, helping group athletes together based on similar levels of impairments to create an even playing field. But it's not always easy to understand â€” here's our guide to the basics.

title.children: Paralympic classification can be confusing â€” here's how it works

image.altText: Liz Ellis speaks in front of a microphone in a blue suit

props.synopsis: Despite boasting similar participation rates to Australian rules football, netball receives far less government support. Liz Ellis says that must change as Netball Australia prepares to host a 2027 World Cup and push its case for the 2032 Brisbane Olympics.

title.children: 'We've got to bang our own drum': Now is netball's time to be bold

image.altText: Rear view of woman in hospital gown sitting on bed.

props.synopsis: Australia's largest health and medical research funding body has recommended sex, gender, variations of sex characteristics and sexual orientation be routinely considered in health and medical research.

title.children: Medical research has a sex and gender problem. New standards hope to change that

image.altText: An old stone building with a red dome

props.synopsis: A "devious" Adelaide woman who stole millions from the savings and super accounts of elderly victims, using some of the funds on hire cars and hotels, has not revealed what she did with all of the money, a court has heard.

title.children: 73yo 'con artist' swindled millions from vulnerable elderly victims in 'shocking' scheme, court told

image.altText: QPS ConstablesÂ Rachel McCrow and Matthew Arnold

props.synopsis: It's the fifth and final week of an inquest into the 2022 tragedy, which claimed the life of two police officers and a neighbour.

title.children: Ballistic police vest would not have saved officer killed at Wieambilla, inquest hears

image.altText: A demonstrator reacts as he holds a cutout of Indonesian President Joko Widodo

props.synopsis: One thing is clear: Indonesia's democrats will not let their hard-won system of checks and balances be dismantled without a fight.

title.children: Lobster rolls, nepotism and the 'Javanese king': Why Indonesians are 'deadnaming' President Jokowi

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and wearing glasses looking at the camera with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: What was meant to be a dream holiday in Japan for Cassandra Nichterlein and her young family turned into a costly nightmare when their return flight from Japan was cancelled.

title.children: A family was left $7,000 out of pocket after a flight cancellation. Jetstar initially offered them $600

image.altText: Men in high-vis stand in a cherry picker bucket, working on a power line.

props.synopsis: WA Premier Roger Cook has criticised state-owned utilities Western Power and Synergy for failing to ensure adequate back-up supplies were in place before undertaking major works on the state's main power grid.

title.children: Western Power, Synergy lashed by premier for 'complete own goal' after eight-hour blackout

image.altText: Boeing starliner

props.synopsis: With NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore stranded aboard the ISS for months, a decorated former astronaut tells the ABC they would know and have trained for the risks but the view is definitely worth it.

title.children: NASA's astronauts now aboard the ISS face 'untold consequences' for their future
